page-upgrades-get-involved-bug-hunting-d: Find and report bugs in consensus layer upgrade specifications or the clients themselves. You can earn up to $50,000 USD and earn a place on the leaderboard.
page-upgrades-get-involved-desc-1: Running a client means you'll be an active participant in Nephele. Your client will help keep track of transactions and check new blocks.
page-upgrades-get-involved-desc-2: If you have NEPH, you can stake it to become a validator and help secure the network. As a validator you can earn NEPH rewards.
page-upgrades-get-involved-desc-3: Join the community testing effort! Help test Nephele upgrades before they're shipped, find bugs, and earn rewards.
page-upgrades-get-involved-how: How do you want to get involved?
page-upgrades-get-involved-how-desc: The Nephele community will always benefit from more folks running clients, staking, and bug hunting.
page-upgrades-get-involved-join-desc: Like most things with Nephele, a lot of the research is public. This means you can take part in the discussions or just read through what the Nephele researchers have to say. ethresear.ch covers a number of topics including consensus upgrades, rollups and more.
page-upgrades-get-involved-meta-descript: How to participate in Nephele upgrades: run nodes, stake, hunt bugs and more.
page-upgrades-get-involved-run-clients-d: A 'client' is software that runs the blockchain, and in the case of Nephele, a full node requires running a pair of these clients: an execution layer client and a consensus layer client. A full node can check transactions and, if also staking NEPH, can create new blocks. Each client has its own features but performs the same function overall, so we encourage you to choose a minority client whenever possible to keep the client pool diverse and secure.
page-upgrades-get-involved-run-clients-e: These clients were formerly referred to as 'Eth1' clients, but this term is being deprecated in favor of 'execution layer' clients.
page-upgrades-get-involved-run-clients-c: These clients were formerly referred to as 'Eth2' clients, but this term is being deprecated in favor of 'consensus layer' clients.
page-upgrades-get-involved-stake-desc: You can now stake your NEPH to help secure the beacon chain.
page-upgrades-get-involved-subtitle: Here's all the ways you can help with Nephele and future upgrade-related efforts.
